image.altText: A school sign on the exterior of a large modern building.

props.synopsis: Some Brindabella Christian College staff have not been paid their salaries on time, with the school's executive principal putting the blame on "timing challenges" related to the payment of school fees by parents.

title.children: 'I ask for your patience': Private school principal tells unpaid staff

image.altText: Orange cones circle space around a tree

props.synopsis: Four Year Six students were injured when a branch fell from a tree during a school excursion at Government House, with one taken to hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Schoolgirl critically injured during visit to Government House in Canberra

image.altText: Red poppies left at a sculpture

props.synopsis: A sculpture at the Australian War Memorial representing the impact of service-related trauma on veterans and their families is providing a place for grieving and commemoration one year since being officially dedicated.

title.children: 'I miss your smile': Letters and photos left at war memorial sculpture

image.altText: A woman holding a black poodle dog in one arm, and a ribbon award in the other hand.

props.synopsis: For two weeks every February a dog show takes over Bermagui, but competing is a year-round obsession for "perfectionist" Paige Clarke and Australia's top miniature poodle Beastie.

title.children: Blowing into town is all part of being Australia's top poodle

image.altText: a man in a green shirt crosses his arms at a table

props.synopsis: Canberra is widely considered 'the most renter-friendly' city, but amid constant legislative changes in favour of tenants, that title may be coming at a cost to landlords, with investors leaving the ACT.

title.children: Investors leaving Australia's 'most renter-friendly' city

image.altText: damaged gravestones

props.synopsis: The 180-year-old Queanbeyan Riverside Cemetery is home to its fair share of ghost stories, urban myths and legends, but locals fear for its future due to a lack of maintenance and vandalism.

title.children: Historical cemetery known for floating coffins and ghost stories in grave danger

image.altText: a bearded man wearing a blue suit and sunglasses walks in front of the ACT Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: It took a jury three days in the ACT Supreme Court to find Aleksander Ivanovski guilty of removing a condom during an encounter with the victim in 2021.

title.children: Man found guilty of stealthing sex worker at Canberra brothel

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: Angus McKay, 32, will serve two months in prison of an 18-month jail sentence, in what is the first sentencing in Canberra following a major review of sexual assault cases.

title.children: Families clash outside Canberra court after man jailed for raping former friend

image.altText: Men in balaclavas and bullet-proof vests reading POLICE ICE stand around

props.synopsis: Pacific Islanders living in the US fear sudden removal from loved ones, jobs and their adopted home, as Donald Trump pursues a crackdown on undocumented migrants.

title.children: Tonga says Trump deportation drive is 'an injustice on our society'

image.altText: Man in colourful shirt and long black hair and goatee smiles big standing in front of a radio mic and wearing headphones.

props.synopsis: Colourful cricket writer and commentator Bharat Sundaresan is respected by millions in India. But it took a move to Australia to find true acceptance.

title.children: 'Pale, male and stale': How Bharat is changing the face of cricket

image.altText: A couple and their baby sit next to their house and a sold sign, in a graphic

props.synopsis: The dream of owning property feels out of reach for millions of young Australians. But against the odds, there are young homebuyers achieving it.

title.children: Why young people are buying their first homes in regional Australia

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young man cleaning a gun, cigarette in mouth

props.synopsis: More than 50 years ago, five young men from a small farming community fought in the Vietnam War. Now their stories have been written so people will know them more than "just a name on a plaque".

title.children: Vietnam vet has never worn his medals but his story is immortalised

image.altText: A black and white portrait of a young boy smiling.

props.synopsis: Queensland Health is criticised for moving away from holding independent investigations into patient suicides on the Gold Coast in favour of in-house probes that let treating staff review the care.

title.children: Jonathan died at 28, but a review of his care said parts 'worked well'

image.altText: Kylie Minogue is in a black sleeveless dress and lies on a patch of red carpet where there is a gold star on a black square.

props.synopsis: Global pop sensation Kylie Minogue is honoured with a star on the forecourt of Rod Laver Arena to commemorate 35 years of concerts at the Melbourne Park precinct.

title.children: Hometown honour for Kylie after record-breaking concert success

image.altText: A smiling young man holding a certificate is escorted by a Hamas militant.

props.synopsis: The group was due to be freed in exchange for six Israeli hostages, but vehicles that left Israel's Ofer military prison carrying prisoners quickly turned around and drove back inside.

title.children: Israel delays releasing 620 Palestinians until Hamas offers guarantees

image.altText: Wide shot of three turbine floating on top of the water with two boats

props.synopsis: The federal government will provide $500 million in funding and set "ambitious" targets to use locally-made steel and aluminium in renewable projects, including offshore wind.

title.children: PM promises $500 million to support Australian steel use in wind turbines

image.altText: Jenni Hermoso smiles in a red tracksuit while walking on a running track.

props.synopsis: "My heart is full of each person who was with me and will stay with me in this fight," the star footballer says, while reminding her followers there is "still much work to do".

title.children: Hermoso calls guilty verdict for Rubiales kiss 'important precedent'

image.altText: A male police forensics officer wearing a body-length white jumpsuit and hairnet while using a black camera at a crime scene

props.synopsis: A man who was on a terror watch list is arrested over a knife attack in the city of Mulhouse that left one person dead and two police officers seriously injured.

title.children: Macron calls fatal stabbing in France an 'Islamic terror act'

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Flames engulfing a hotel at night

props.synopsis: Flames destroyed Bollon's only hotel on Saturday night, leaving residents without a pub or cafe, just weeks before the start of the tourist season.

title.children: 'Part of history going up in flames': Fire destroys town's only pub

image.altText: US Vice-President JD Vance on stage with several other people, addressing an audience.

props.synopsis: The shadow of American "broligarchy" looms over global talks on artificial intelligence regulation in Paris, as big tech wins controversial concessions amid a sudden shift in the AI arms race.

title.children: US 'broligarchs' win AI concessions as Europe 'spooked'

image.altText: A close-up of an old man in glasses and a white hat speaks into a microphone and gestures.

props.synopsis: The Vatican says Pope Francis's health has deteriorated over the past 24 hours, adding that the pontiff had suffered a "prolonged asthma-like respiratory crisis" and had needed blood transfusions.

title.children: Pope 'critical' after 'prolonged respiratory crisis', Vatican says

image.altText: Image of a steamed fish on a plate.

props.synopsis: The CSIRO unveils new fish variety that could one day make a splash on dinner tables across Australia. They are working on developing a sustainable, profitable and eco-friendly farmed fish using an Australian native white fish few have heard of.

title.children: Tired of barramundi and cod? A new white fish species is on the way

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: The visit coincides with a major push by Australian superannuation funds to build their case for increased investment opportunities in the US, starting with a "super showcase" in Washington DC and New York.

title.children: Jim Chalmers heads to US to make tariffs case

image.altText: Two photos next to each other of a woman with shoulder length light brown hair

props.synopsis: What happened to Tayla Spies? For three weeks her family and police have searched for clues to the mystery without any luck.

title.children: Three weeks ago, Tayla Spies left a sleepy country town and vanished

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: Today might be the day you finally do okay at this quiz, but don't worry I'm not holding my breath.

title.children: Got what it takes to nail this quiz? I think it's unlikely

image.altText: two firefighters walk through a burnt forest

props.synopsis: Emergency services crews are facing another period of high fire danger this weekend, with a group of bushfires continuing to burn in Tasmania's west.

title.children: Total fire ban in place as Tasmanian bushfires enter third week

image.altText: A woman in a  motorised wheelchair smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: AI-powered voice recognition software is helping my career as a journalist and my studies, but it's not without risks.

title.children: Doctors thought I'd die by the age of 2. Now AI is transforming my life

image.altText: Residential houses on a hill at sunset.

props.synopsis: The big banks wasted no time in announcing they would cut rates for mortgage borrowers after the RBA reduced the cash rate on Tuesday. So why haven't the changes taken effect yet?

title.children: Why the banks are waiting to pass on the RBA's rate cut to home loans

image.altText: Man standing next to sheep yards.

props.synopsis: Division is widespread in rural Australian communities over the roll-out of renewable energy projects, with neighbours and lifelong friends in conflict over proposed developments.

title.children: 'It's not the way of country people': Division brews over renewables

image.altText: Carlton's Jagga Smith walks off the field alongside a trainer during a preseason AFL game.

props.synopsis: Jagga Smith is the second top draft pick to cop a nasty injury in the AFL preseason, with scans confirming a torn ACL for Carlton's third overall pick.

title.children: Carlton's top AFL draft pick to miss season as scans confirm the worst

image.altText: Jac Morgan, Maro Itoje and Finn Russell composite

props.synopsis: England withstands some silky Scottish backline play but holds firm to win the Calcutta Cup, while an off-colour Ireland battles hard against a resurgent Wales team that is cruelled by a controversial new rule in the week's Six Nations action.

title.children: Lions watch: Off-colour Irish tested by Wales, England stands firm

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell congratulates Josh Inglis after Australia defeats England at ICC Champions Trophy.

props.synopsis: Josh Inglis posts his first ODI century as Australia bludgeons the largest total in Champions Trophy history to pull off a spectacular five-wicket win over England in Lahore.

title.children: Inglis ton lifts Aussies to famous ODI win over England

image.altText: Grace Harris bowls in WPL

props.synopsis: Grace Harris becomes the first Australian to take a hat-trick in the Women's Premier League, a feat the batting all-rounder saw coming.

title.children: Aussie Harris makes history with WPL hat-trick

image.altText: A woman with green hair sings in darkness on stage

props.synopsis: Dozens of Billie Eilish fans have had their tickets stolen as the star tours Australia this week. Here's how to avoid it happening to you.

title.children: How reusing a password could ruin your big night out
